alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 6:50PM CDT until May 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Sandy Creek near Cordele affecting Colorado, Wharton and Jackson Counties. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Sandy Creek...including Cordele...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River near Speaks. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins with the river one hundred yards wide in the vicinity of the gauge. The approaches to the FM 530 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 25.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.0 feet on 10/05/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Navidad River Speaks 24.0 23.7 Sun 2 pm CDT 24.8 18.1 12.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 700 AM CDT.
